title: Fort Pulaski National Monument: Brochures & Site Bulletins
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Brochures & Site Bulletins            Brochures and Site Bulletins       The Cockspur Island Lighthouse Clinging to the tip of Cockspur Island, the Cockspur Island Lighthouse has withstood crashing waves, the roar of cannons and the wrath of time. The Nation Unravels On January 3, 1861, Fort Pulaski is siezed by the state of Georgia, sending the for and Savannah on a path toward war. From Slave to Soldier on the Georgia Coast With the fall of Fort Pulaski in April 1862, slaves began running away from nearby plantations hoping for a chance for freedom. The Forgotten Warriors Asian soldiers in the Civil War personify one of the war's enduring legacies-- that of individual strength and perseverance in the face of great adversity. Fort Pulaski Trail Guide It's more than just a fort! Use this trail guide to explore all that Fort Pulaski National Monument has to offer.
